item.title: Interview with Author Mark Scandrette: Part 1
item.description:
Interview with Author Mark Scandrette: Part 1

Hello Friends, We are pleased to welcome Mark Scandrette, author of Free: Spending Your Time and Money on What Matters Most , to the blog today! Mark is a longtime friend and changemaker based in San Francisco. We were able to sit down briefly and catch up with Mark while he was in Seattle last week.

item.title: Congregational Resource Center | The Association of Religion Data Archives
item.description:
Congregational Resource Center | The Association of Religion Data Archives

Ahead of the Trend is a collegial effort, enlisting the cooperation of researchers, universities, journal editors, institutes and associations of scholars to increase the impact and awareness of important findings in religion research.

Hello Friends, We are pleased to welcome Mark Scandrette, author of Free: Spending Your Time and Money on What Matters Most , to the blog today! item.title: Headbanging in the house of God: Rio congregation worships with heavy metal
item.description:
Headbanging in the house of God: Rio congregation worships with heavy metal

Of the many macabre ways in which the Metan√≥ia chapel differs from its counterparts around the world, perhaps the most revealing is its noticeboard. As well as the usual updates on services, baptisms and weddings, it includes a host of blood-curdling advertisements for upcoming events.

item.title: 7 types of evangelicals -- and how they'll affect 2016
item.description:
7 types of evangelicals -- and how they'll affect 2016

Like many political axioms, though, it papers over a complex reality. But evangelicals rarely vote as a bloc, especially in the primaries. They disagree not only on the candidates but also on more basic principles like how active Christians should be in partisan politics.

item.title: Staying is the New Going
item.description:
Staying is the New Going

Uploaded by Frontline Church Planting on 2015-08-31.

item.title: Loneliness grows from individual ache to public health hazard
item.description:
Loneliness grows from individual ache to public health hazard

It torments the young and terrorizes the old. It carved "caverns" in Emily Dickinson's soul and left William Blake "bereaved of light." Loneliness, long a bane of humanity, is increasingly seen today as a serious public health hazard.

item.title: Creating Wealth in African American Communities
item.description:
Creating Wealth in African American Communities

by Bryan Lehrer Creating Wealth in African American Communities This post informally announces a new project and partnership that Neighborhood Economics is taking on surrounding wealth creation in African American communities. It is written by Bryan Lehrer, an intern at Sphaera, who has teamed up Kevin Jones and N.E.

item.title: The Ethics of Building Great Communities - Project for Public Spaces
item.description:
The Ethics of Building Great Communities - Project for Public Spaces

Calling all architects, planners, designers, developers, city agencies, activists, neighbors, and politicians ... All of us are involved in shaping cities, places, and communities. Whether the project we are working on is a private development or a public open space, it is important that we strive to accommodate human activity by developing tangible elements (such [...]
